wikipedia_page.main: Liam James Halligan (born 29 April 1969) is a British economist, journalist, author and broadcaster. He is currently economics and business editor at GB News, where he co-presents a daily show.Since 2003, Halligan has written a weekly column in The Sunday Telegraph. He also presents The Telegraph's weekly Planet Normal podcast.

On 13 March, it was announced that Liam Halligan would join the channel as economics and business editor. On 18 March, the channel announced that comedian Andrew Doyle would join it to host a weekly current affairs show. On 23 March, it was announced that Euronews' Rosie Wright would join the channel's breakfast presenting team. On 25 March, it was said that BBC News newsreader Simon McCoy would present an afternoon show. On 19 March, it was announced that broadcaster Kirsty Gallacher would join the breakfast team. On 2 April, former ITV News presenter Alastair Stewart was announced as the host of a weekend news and current affairs programme. Also hired were archaeologist Neil Oliver, to host a weekly current affairs and interview programme, and former Labour MP Gloria De Piero, to host an afternoon programme. On 23 April, it was announced that Mercy Muroki would co-host a daytime programme tackling everyday issues. On 11 June, Isabel Webster joined the channel as the co-host of a weekly news review programme.

Of frequent praise was the writing style. British economist and journalist Liam Halligan called it "businesslike but culturally savvy", highlighting the care and skill in covering social trends. Economics professor Robert J. Gordon praised the book's presentation of American history as vivid, insightful, and of the high standard of a work from The Economist. In the view of Goldman Sachs strategist and economist Abby Joseph Cohen, "It's extremely well-written. It is an absorbing read."
